content.title: Junior Research Fellowship (JRF) And Research Associateship (RA) For Foreign Nationals
content.beneficiary: Foreign students and teachers from developing countries
content.details: The scheme was initiated keeping in view the political and cultural bilateral relations of India with other developing countries of Asia, Africa, and Latin America. The scheme has opened new vistas for foreign students and teachers, enabling them to come to India and undertake advanced studies and research in sciences, humanities, and social sciences in Indian Universities.
benefits: Financial assistance for JRF: Rs. 12,000/-p.m. for initial two years, Rs. 14,000/-p.m. for remaining period
Financial assistance for RA: Rs. 16,000/-p.m. (Fixed) for 4 years
Contingency support for JRF and RA
HRA as per the rule of the concerned institution
eligibility: For JRF: 35 years for male candidates, 40 years for female candidates as of 1st July of the year of application. Must have at least a high-class master’s degree with a second-class bachelor’s degree or a second-class master’s degree with a first-class bachelor’s degree.

For RA: 40 years for male candidates, 45 years for female candidates as of 1st July of the year of application. Must have a doctorate degree, published research work, and evidence of independent research work.
exclusions: Failure in any of the examinations related to M.Phil/Ph.D.
content.application_process: Online. Applications are invited through Indian embassies/Indian missions abroad. Candidates must send applications through the university they propose to work with, endorsed by their respective embassies.

faqs.question: Students And Teachers From Which Developing Countries Are Eligible To Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Students and teachers from developing countries of Asia/Africa and Latin America are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: Is There Any Eligibility Criteria Regarding The Age Of The Candidate?
faqs.answer: For Junior Research Fellowship (JRF): 35 years for male candidates and 40 years for female candidates. For Research Associateship (RA): 40 years for male candidates and 45 years for female candidates.

faqs.question: Is There Any Eligibility Criteria Regarding The Educational Qualification Of The Candidate?
faqs.answer: For JRF: At least a high-class master’s degree with a second-class bachelor’s degree or second-class master’s degree with a first-class bachelor’s degree. For RA: A doctorate degree, published research work, and evidence of independent research work.

faqs.question: How Many Slots Are Available Under The Scheme For Junior Research Fellowship (JRF) And For Research Associateship (RA)?
faqs.answer: 20 slots for JRF and 7 for RA.

faqs.question: Is The Tenure Extendable?
faqs.answer: The tenure of these awards is four years (Non-extendable) for both JRF and RA.

faqs.question: What Is The Amount Of Fellowship Provided To The JRF?
faqs.answer: Rs. 12,000/-p.m. for the initial two years, Rs. 14,000/-p.m. for the remaining period.

faqs.question: What Is The Amount Of Fellowship Provided To The RA?
What If The University Fails To Provide A Suitable Single-Seated Hostel Accommodation In The Institution To The JRF?
faqs.answer: HRA as per rules of the university/institution will be paid to the Fellow subject to the submission of the HRA certificate.
